results.title: Across the frontiers
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Stanley Hawes and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film was made at the invitation of the United Nations Organisation to illustrate the part played by Australia in a UNESCO campaign to foster better understanding between nations. Technical advances have broken down the old barriers to knowledge, but there still remain the barriers in men’s minds. The film illustrates the work being done by UNESCO in breaking down these remaining barriers.

results.title: About horses
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: Machinery has replaced the horse in the field of light transport, and has invaded the medium and heavy traction and transport fields, but in the Australian outback there are jobs that only a horse can do. This film shows the types of horses bred in Australia from the heavy draught to the race-horse and the circus pony.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Thompson and Australian news and Information Bureau

results.title: Aboriginal Education
results.creator_credit: John Sullivan, Ross Campbell and AVEC Film
results.brief_description: A survey of the progress made in Aboriginal education in Victoria in 1976. Shows the wide variety of educational courses operating and encourages communities in different areas to set up their own courses. Also presents the teaching of Aboriginal culture in primary schools and reasons Aborigines get involved.

results.title: City of chromatic dissolution
results.brief_description:
Arthur and Corinne Cantrill used footage of Melbourne’s cityscapes and buildings from the mid 1980s to create this evocative piece on movement, colour and the city. The various parts of inner city Melbourne were originally shot on black and white negative in three colour separation, then printed on Eastmancolor film. The results are static shots of the city, where the movement of people and vehicles have a quality that is colour saturated and ghostly. This is complemented with a sountrack both urban and discordant in tone.
This is one of a series of films made by the Cantrills that experiment with dramatic distortions of colour through three-colour separation processes. The original inspiration for this project (as the filmmakers report in the final edition of Cantrills Filmnotes) came back in the mid-1970s when Kodak stopped making the Cantrills’ preferred 16mm reversal colour film stocks.

results.title: Memories
results.brief_description: Memories of the early years of Moomba, particularly of the pageant and my involvement in those early years. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: A Moomba Magic Moment
results.brief_description: It all started with my promotional photo and my girlfriend Gail Gordon, she entered me into the Moomba Quest, and the rest is history. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Moom
results.brief_description: Mum and I would laugh at how the Moomba festival was named after our deadly mooms. Moom refers to our bottoms. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.
